abstract: The Federal Trade Commission has begun an inquiry into whether the close ties between the boards of two of technology’s most prominent companies, Apple and Google, amount to a violation of antitrust laws, The New York Times’s Miguel Helft and Brad Stone reported, citing several people briefed on the inquiry.
lead_paragraph: The Federal Trade Commission has begun an inquiry into whether the close ties between the boards of two of technology’s most prominent companies, Apple and Google, amount to a violation of antitrust laws, The New York Times’s Miguel Helft and Brad Stone reported, citing several people briefed on the inquiry.

headline.main: Board Ties at Apple and Google Are Scrutinized

abstract: Apple may introduce an age-rating system for iPhone applications that would presumably make it easier for developers to win approval for adult-oriented apps.
snippet: Apple may introduce an age-rating system for iPhone applications that would presumably make it easier for developers to win approval for adult-oriented apps.
lead_paragraph: Update | 6:34 p.m.  Details added about what Apple previously said about parental controls.

headline.main: Apple May Offer Age Controls for iPhone Apps
